author: MalteseFalcon
title: Great new Batcave
review:
After missing out on the earlier Batman sets, I was happy to get a new chance at a Batcave and this one is truly worth the 100 dollars. 

To begin with the mini figures; this set includes the new Batman mini figure found in other sets for this year, as well as a Bruce Wayne, Robin (based on Damien Wayne), Bat Woman but also includes two bonus mini figures they did not have to include but gave us anyway - Catwoman and Two Face. 

The mini Tumbler is a nice build with all 6 wheels having their own part, rather than being dual connected with a technic piece. The Clayface build reminded me of the older Bionicle sets, with an interesting head piece that allows for a moving mouth. 

The Batcave itself consists of 3 separate platforms that build together. The main part in the middle offers the most details for the set, including stickers for the Abraham Lincoln coin and a Joker card. Usually I don't care for sets with a lot of stickers but in this one, I don't really mind it, cause it adds a nice touch of detail. 

For those wondering about the middle entrance, yes, the new Batmobile will fit properly and can drive right through. 

The other connectable pieces are the small prison cell which has a wall breaking mechanic and the platform leading into the Wayne Manor. There is a cool mechanic involved where you place a mini figure on the opening hatch, remove a technic piece and that's how Bruce Wayne becomes Batman. 

Overall this was a nice set with a variety of different dark colors that fit the Batman theme, offered great mini figures and was well detailed. I look forward to adding onto this.
